entries.content: Starting research on gemini-cli integration. Goal: Understand how to use Gemini like Claude/Codex and identify headless feature limitations. User mentioned they just added gemini-cli.

User insight: Headless mode may not be sufficient. User suggests using the code inside the Gemini CLI directly instead of the headless interface. This makes sense - we need the same level of control Claude Code and Codex have.

## Gemini CLI Integration Research - Key Findings

**Headless Limitations:**
- Only returns final JSON with stats, no streaming events
- No tool_use_start/tool_use_end visibility  
- No real-time thinking display
- Batch processing model (not suitable for live UI)

**Solution: Use @google/gemini-cli-core Package**

The gemini-cli has a core package that exports:
1. GeminiChat - Streaming chat with event system
2. Turn - Event types (Content, ToolCallRequest, ToolCallResponse, Thought, etc.)
3. GeminiEventType enum - Proper event typing
4. All tools, config, and utilities

**Event Types Available:**
- Content (model responses)
- ToolCallRequest 
- ToolCallResponse
- ToolCallConfirmation
- Thought
- Error
- Finished
- Retry
- and more...

**Next Steps:**
- Import @google/gemini-cli-core into Sementix
- Create adapter similar to Codex that uses GeminiChat.sendMessageStream()
- Transform Gemini events to our universal message format
- Get same real-time experience as Claude/Codex
